what: An R wrapper to the BambooHR API
title: An R wrapper to the BambooHR API
text: bambooHR R wrapper bambooHR API. supplying company domain API access token, users can seamlessly make API requests built-R functions. Get employees, employee files, reports tables, within R.

title: An R wrapper to the BambooHR API
text: install latest release CRAN, run: Alternatively install latest version GitHub, run: Finally, load package:

title: An R wrapper to the BambooHR API
text: order obtain API key, need login bambooHR via account administrative privileges. Hit user icon top-right select ‘API Keys’. Next, enter name API key API Key Name field click Generate Key. Copy key clipboard. Now run config_setup() function, supplying API key company domain, plus optional filepath store config file. package functions now pull configuration information automatically.

title: Coerce to ISO 8601 — ISO_8601
text: Coerce dates datetimes ISO 8601 format Bamboo HR REST API.

title: Coerce to ISO 8601 — ISO_8601
text: datetime Character string. datetime coerce. date Character string. date coerce.

title: Coerce to ISO 8601 — ISO_8601
text: Character string ISO 8601 format.

title: Coerce to ISO 8601 — ISO_8601
text: Input can simply given character string. See date_formats allowed format types.

title: Coerce to ISO 8601 — ISO_8601
text: as_ISO8601_character: Coerce datetime ISO8601 format. convert represent datetime relative UTC using + notation. Milliseconds removed. coerce_ISO8601: Coerce date ISO8601 format. convert date UTC (applying Z notation) remove milliseconds.

what: Build URL Endpoints with Company Domain and API Version — build_url
title: Build URL Endpoints with Company Domain and API Version — build_url
text: Used generate base API request URL. URLs start "https://api.bamboohr.com/api/gateway.php/company_domain" forms base URL query string can appended make full request URL.

title: Build URL Endpoints with Company Domain and API Version — build_url
Build URL Endpoints with Company Domain and API Version — build_url
text: company_domain subdomain used access BambooHR. access BambooHR https://mycompany.bamboohr.com, company_domain "mycompany". Default value obtained options("bambooHR.company_name"). can also set config file using config_setup("api key", "company_domain"). api_version Version API use make request. Default "v1". base_url URL BambooHR API. Default "https://api.bamboohr.com/api/gateway.php".

title: Build URL Endpoints with Company Domain and API Version — build_url
text: character vector URL API version company domain give base URL API requests.

what: Create a JSON config file — config_setup
title: Create a JSON config file — config_setup
text: Create JSON config file

title: Create a JSON config file — config_setup
Create a JSON config file — config_setup
text: apikey API key access bambooHR API. User prompted enter one supplied companyname subdomain used access BambooHR. access BambooHR https://mycompany.bamboohr.com, companyname "mycompany" conffile string giving path configuration file written. automatically attempt load default location ~/.bambooHR_user_config.json (can changed via bambooHR.config_file) entry options).

title: Create a JSON config file — config_setup

title: Check Date Format — date_formats

title: Check Date Format — date_formats
text: is_ymd: Check format YYYY-MM-DD is_ymd_hms: Check format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS is_ymd_hmsms: Check format YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM:SS.mmm

title: Retrieve A Company File — get_company_file
text: `get_company_file` takes file_id (string), company domain (string), api version (string), base_url (string) arguments requests returns data corresponding file BambooHR API.

title: Retrieve A Company File — get_company_file
text: file_id ID file get BambooHR. company_domain company's domain name api_version version BambooHR API base_url base url API gateway

title: Retrieve A Company File — get_company_file
text: returns response object.

title: Retrieve A Company File — get_company_file
text: Mark Druffel, mdruffel@propellerpdx.com

title: Retrieve A Company File — get_company_file
code: response <- get_company_file( "480", company_domain = "ascent", api_version = "v1", base_url = "https://api.bamboohr.com/api/gateway.php" ) #> Error in get_company_file("480", company_domain = "ascent", api_version = "v1",     base_url = "https://api.bamboohr.com/api/gateway.php"): could not find function "get_company_file"

what: Get employee data by specifying a set of fields. — get_employee
title: Get employee data by specifying a set of fields. — get_employee
text: suitable getting basic employee information, including current values fields part historical table, like job title, compensation information. See fields endpoint list possible  fields.

title: Get employee data by specifying a set of fields. — get_employee
code: get_employee(   id = "directory",   fields = NULL,   only_current = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE,   api_version = "v1" )

title: Get employee data by specifying a set of fields. — get_employee
text: id Employee IDs (character numeric). default "directory" give directory employees, along table possible fields. special employee ID zero (0) means use employee ID associated API key (). fields Character vector fields return. see available fields, see column names get_employee(). only_current Setting false return future dated values history table fields. verbose Logical, default FALSE. Whether return fields dataframe [id = "directory"].

title: Get employee data by specifying a set of fields. — get_employee
text: Tibble (dataframe), unless [verbose = TRUE] [id = "directory"],  case list fields dataframe directory dataframe.

title: Get employee data by specifying a set of fields. — get_employee
code: if (FALSE) { get_employee() get_employee(0, fields = c("firstName", "lastName")) get_employee(c(0, 1, 2), fields = c("firstName", "lastName", "jobTitle")) }

title: Get Company Report — get_report

title: Get Company Report — get_report
code: get_report(   id,   format = c("CSV", "PDF", "XLS", "XML", "JSON"),   field_filtering = TRUE,   only_current = TRUE,   api_version = "v1" )

title: Get Company Report — get_report
text: id report ID. can get report number hovering report name reports page grabbing ID. format output format report. Supported formats: CSV, PDF, XLS, XML, JSON. field_filtering Logical, default [TRUE]. Whether apply duplicate field filtering. only_current Logical default [TRUE]. report limited current employees.

title: Get Company Report — get_report

title: Get Time Off Requests — get_timeoff_requests
text: Get Time Requests

title: Get Time Off Requests — get_timeoff_requests
code: get_timeoff_requests(   start,   end,   id = NULL,   action = c("view", "approve"),   employee_id = NULL,   type = NULL,   status = c("approved", "denied", "superseded", "requested", "canceled"),   api_version = "v1" )

title: Get Time Off Requests — get_timeoff_requests
text: start Character format "YYYY-MM-DD". show time occurs /specified start date. end Character format "YYYY-MM-DD". show time occurs /specified end date. id (optional) Integer - particular request ID limit response . action (optional) - Limit requests user particular level access . Legal values : "view" "approve". employee_id (optional) Character - particular employee ID limit response . type (optional) - vector time types IDs include limit response . Default types included. status (optional) - vector request status values include. Legal values "approved", "denied", "superseded", "requested", "canceled". Default status types. api_version (optional) - Version API use make request. Default "v1".

title: Get Time Off Requests — get_timeoff_requests
text: tibble::tibble() object.

title: Get Time Off Requests — get_timeoff_requests
text: https://documentation.bamboohr.com/reference/time--1

title: Get Time Off Requests — get_timeoff_requests
code: if (FALSE) { # find valid valid types types <- get_timeoff_types() type_ids <- types %>% tidyr::drop_na(id) %>%  dplyr::pull(id)  res <- get_timeoff_requests("2022-01-01", "2022-02-01", type = type_ids)  res2 <- get_timeoff_requests("2022-01-01", "2022-02-01", action = "approve", status = c("approved", "denied"))  res3 <- get_timeoff_requests("2022-01-01", "2022-02-01", employee_id = "4")  }

title: Get Time Off Types — get_timeoff_types
text: Wrapper get_meta function returns time types

title: Get Time Off Types — get_timeoff_types
text: vector type ids

title: Get Time Off Types — get_timeoff_types
text: https://documentation.bamboohr.com/reference/get-time--types

title: Get Time Off Types — get_timeoff_types
code: if (FALSE) { types <- get_timeoff_types() type_ids <- types %>% tidyr::drop_na(id) %>%  dplyr::pull(id) }

title: Use Config File — use_config
text: Choose specific configuration file supply API key company domain.

title: Use Config File — use_config
text: config Filepath config file.

title: Use Config File — use_config
text: [NULL] invisibly.

title: Use Config File — use_config
text: rare circumstances, may useful swap multiple configuration files, example comparing results different accounts possibly different permissions. case user may set-two config files [config_setup] different locations (see [conffile] argument), swap [use_config]. chosen config file used subsequent API calls, [use_config] sets global options variables package environment. course, [config_setup] , however [use_config] expose API key called.

title: Use Config File — use_config
code: if (FALSE) { # Setup 2 configuration files config_setup(apikey = "key", companyname = "Ascent", conffile = "example.json") config_setup(apikey = "key2", companyname = "Descent", conffile = "example2.json")  # Jump between them use_config("example.json") use_config("example2.json")  # Remove them when finished unlink("example.json") unlink("example2.json") }
